metadata.title: PCP Theorem Formalization
metadata.description: Formalization plan for NP = PCP(log n, 1) following Dinur's gap amplification proof

nodes.name: PCP Definitions
nodes.description: Core PCP verifier definitions, oracle interface, PCP class predicate

nodes.name: Language Encodings
nodes.description: Bitstring encodings, input representations, SAT language definition

nodes.name: PCP(log n, 1) ‚äÜ NP
nodes.signature: theorem PCP_subset_NP : ‚àÄ L, PCP (Œª n, O(log n)) (Œª _, O(1)) L ‚Üí L ‚àà NP
nodes.description: Trivial inclusion: enumerate all random strings and include proof bits in NP certificate

nodes.name: Constraint Graph Definitions
nodes.description: Binary CSP, assignments, satisfaction, UNSAT value

nodes.name: UNSAT Value
nodes.signature: def BinaryCSP.unsat {V Œ±} [Fintype V] [Fintype Œ±] (G : BinaryCSP V Œ±) : ‚Ñö

nodes.notes: Uses finite maximization via [Fintype (V ‚Üí Œ±)]

nodes.name: 3-Colorability is NP-hard
nodes.signature: theorem threeColor_to_csp : 3Color ‚â§p (G ‚Ü¶ (UNSAT(G)=0))
nodes.description: Reduction from 3-Colorability to 2-CSP satisfiability

nodes.name: Expander Graph Definitions
nodes.description: Combinatorial expansion, spectral gap, explicit families
nodes.notes: Major missing mathlib4 dependency - may need to port from Isabelle AFP

nodes.name: Cheeger's Inequality
nodes.signature: theorem cheeger_inequality : ‚àÉ h, Œª‚ÇÅ(G) ‚â§ d - h¬≤/(2*d)
nodes.description: Relates spectral gap to edge expansion
nodes.notes: Core spectral graph theory - needs Rayleigh quotient formalization

nodes.name: Preprocess (Regularization + Expanderization)
nodes.signature: def preprocess {V Œ±} [Fintype V] [Fintype Œ±] (G : BinaryCSP V Œ±) : Œ£ (V' : Type*) [Fintype V'], BinaryCSP V' Œ±
nodes.description: Transform CSP into regular, expanding graph via vertex clouds and edge addition

nodes.name: Preprocessing Preserves UNSAT
nodes.signature: lemma preprocess_spec : ‚àÉ Œª d Œ≤‚ÇÅ, Œ≤‚ÇÅ*UNSAT(G) ‚â§ UNSAT(preprocess G) ‚â§ UNSAT(G) ‚àß regular ‚àß Œª ‚â§ const
nodes.description: Preprocessing maintains UNSAT up to constant factor while achieving regularity and expansion

nodes.name: Graph Powering
nodes.signature: def power {V Œ±} [Fintype V] [Fintype Œ±] (t : ‚Ñï) (G : BinaryCSP V Œ±) : BinaryCSP V (Fin (Gdegree G) ‚Üí Œ±)
nodes.description: G^t with walk-based constraints; alphabet grows to tuples

nodes.name: Powering Amplifies UNSAT
nodes.signature: theorem powering_soundness : ‚àÉ Œ≤‚ÇÇ>0, UNSAT(G^t) ‚â• Œ≤‚ÇÇ * ‚àöt * min (UNSAT(G)) (1/t)
nodes.description: Core gap amplification: powering increases UNSAT by ~‚àöt
nodes.notes: HARDEST LEMMA - requires random walk mixing bounds and spectral inequalities

nodes.name: Assignment Tester Interface
nodes.description: Assignment tester structure with soundness and completeness properties

nodes.name: Composition Reduces Alphabet
nodes.signature: theorem composition_lemma : ‚àÉ Œ≤‚ÇÉ>0 c, UNSAT(G ‚àò P) ‚â• Œ≤‚ÇÉ * UNSAT(G) ‚àß size ‚â§ c * size(G)
nodes.description: Composing CSP with assignment tester preserves UNSAT while reducing alphabet

nodes.name: Constant-Alphabet Tester Exists
nodes.signature: theorem tester_exists : ‚àÉ P : AssignmentTester, Fintype.card P.Œ£0 = O(1) ‚àß P.Œµ ‚â• Œµ0
nodes.description: Explicit construction via Long Code
nodes.notes: Decouplable module - can be treated as black box initially

nodes.name: Dinur Main Theorem
nodes.signature: theorem dinur_main : ‚àÉ Œ£0, ‚àÄ Œ£, ‚àÉ C Œ±‚àà(0,1), ‚àÄ G, ‚àÉ G', size(G') ‚â§ C*size(G) ‚àß UNSAT(G') ‚â• min(2*UNSAT(G), Œ±)
nodes.description: Gap-doubling with linear size growth - combines preprocessing, powering, and composition

nodes.name: Gap-CSP ‚áî PCP(log n, O(1))
nodes.signature: theorem PCP_gapCSP_equiv : (NP ‚äÜ PCP(log, O(1))) ‚Üî (Gap-2CSP with constant gap is NP-hard)
nodes.description: Standard equivalence between PCP and Gap-CSP formulations

nodes.name: NP-hard Constant-Gap 2-CSP
nodes.signature: theorem gap2csp_hard : ‚àÉ Œ£0, NP-hard ({G | UNSAT(G)=0} vs UNSAT(G)‚â•Œ±)
nodes.description: Iterate Dinur main theorem O(log n) times to boost gap to constant

nodes.name: NP = PCP(log n, 1)
nodes.signature: theorem PCP_theorem : NP = { L | PCP (Œª n, O(log n)) (Œª _, O(1)) L }
nodes.description: Final statement combining all pieces

nodes.name: Adjacency Matrix

nodes.name: Graph Eigenvalues
nodes.signature: def eigenvalues (G : SimpleGraph V) : Multiset ‚Ñù

nodes.name: Rayleigh Quotient

nodes.description: Relates second eigenvalue to edge expansion (one direction of Cheeger)

nodes.name: Random Walk on Graph

nodes.name: Spectral Mixing Lemma
nodes.signature: lemma spectral_mixing : ‚ÄñP^t - U‚Äñ ‚â§ Œª‚ÇÇ^t
nodes.description: Random walk converges to uniform exponentially fast in spectral gap

nodes.name: Path Sampling Concentration
nodes.signature: lemma path_concentration : Pr[walks satisfy bad event] ‚â§ exp(-Œ©(t))
nodes.description: Random t-step paths concentrate around expected values
nodes.notes: Uses Chernoff + independence; needed for powering analysis

nodes.name: Edge Expansion
nodes.signature: def edgeExpansion (G : Graph V) : ‚Ñö
nodes.description: Minimum ratio of edges leaving a set to its size

nodes.name: Vertex Cloud Expansion (prep1)
nodes.signature: def prep1 (G : BinaryCSP V Œ±) : BinaryCSP V' Œ±
nodes.description: Replace each vertex with a cloud expander; add equality constraints

nodes.name: prep1 Preserves UNSAT
nodes.signature: lemma prep1_unsat : UNSAT(G) ‚â§ UNSAT(prep1 G) ‚â§ c‚ÇÅ * UNSAT(G)
nodes.description: Vertex blow-up changes UNSAT by at most constant factor

nodes.name: Edge Expander Addition (prep2)
nodes.signature: def prep2 (G : BinaryCSP V Œ±) : BinaryCSP V Œ±
nodes.description: Add expander edges and self-loops to achieve spectral gap

nodes.name: Preprocessing Achieves Regularity
nodes.signature: lemma preprocess_regular : regular (preprocess G) d
nodes.description: Combined preprocessing produces d-regular graph

nodes.name: Linear Code

nodes.name: Good Codes Exist
nodes.signature: theorem good_linear_codes : ‚àÉ C : LinearCode F n k, distance C ‚â• Œ¥*n ‚àß k ‚â• (1-Œµ)*n

nodes.name: Long Code

nodes.name: Walk Violation Amplifies

nodes.description: Non-typical assignments have many violated t-step walks

nodes.signature: theorem courant_fischer : Œª‚Çñ(A) = inf_{dim(V)=k} sup_{v‚ààV, ‚Äñv‚Äñ=1} ‚ü®Av, v‚ü©

nodes.name: Cheeger Inequality (Easy Direction)
nodes.signature: lemma cheeger_easy : h(G) ‚â• (d - Œª‚ÇÇ) / 2
